meanings.definition: The act of swarming or gathering in large numbers.
meanings.sent1: During the swarmings, the bees covered the entire garden.
meanings.sent2: The swarmings of people at the concert made it hard to find a seat.
meanings.sent3: The swarmings of shoppers at the mall on Black Friday were chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The swarmings of stars in the night sky created a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The swarmings of birds in the sky looked like a moving cloud.

meanings.definition: A large group of insects or other small organisms moving together.
meanings.sent1: The swarmings of ants on the picnic blanket were a nuisance.
meanings.sent2: We watched the swarmings of fireflies light up the summer night.
meanings.sent3: The swarmings of mosquitoes around the campfire were relentless.
meanings.sent4: The swarmings of fish in the river attracted many predators.
meanings.sent5: The swarmings of bees around the hive were a sign of a healthy colony.
